soc.message

Class SOCRejectOffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.message.SOCMessage
      • soc.message.SOCRejectOffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, SOCMessageForGame

    public class SOCRejectOffer
extends SOCMessage
implements SOCMessageForGame
    Typically this message means that the player is rejecting all offers ("no thanks"). Server can also send it with a "reason code" when rejecting a client's trade-related request.

    Typical usage: (without a reason code)

    Sent from rejecting player's client to server. The server then sends a copy of the message to all players to announce the rejection.
    • Message to server is client player's response to a SOCMakeOffer sent earlier this turn.
    • Followed by (from server, to all clients) SOCRejectOffer with the same data.

    With a reason code:

    Sent from server to a player's client in response to their trade offer or request to accept a trade, with the specific reason it was disallowed (REASON_NOT_YOUR_TURN, REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_OFFER, or generic REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_TRADE). See those constants for info about when they're used, or getReasonCode() for general info.

    In a future version or fork, reason codes could also be sent from a rejecting player's client to give a specific reason for the rejection. This would be mentioned in that reason code constant's javadoc. Server would then announce the rejection to all players.

    Reason code field is ignored by clients older than v2.4.50 (VERSION_FOR_REPLY_REASONS). Older clients are sent SOCGameServerText instead.

    Author:
    Robert S. Thomas
    See Also:
    SOCAcceptOffer, Serialized Form

      static int REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_OFFER
      Server's reason code when the requesting client can't make this trade offer now.

      static int REASON_NOT_YOUR_TURN
      Server's reply reason code when the requesting client can't make this trade now because it isn't their turn.

    • Field Detail

      • VERSION_FOR_REPLY_REASONS

        public static final int VERSION_FOR_REPLY_REASONS
        Minimum server and client version number which uses reply/disallow reason codes (REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_TRADE, etc), which are ignored by older clients: 2450 for v2.4.50. Older clients are sent SOCGameServerText instead.
        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_TRADE

        public static final int REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_TRADE
        Server's generic reason code when the requesting client can't offer or accept this trade now for whatever reason. Usually because they don't have the right resources to give. See getReasonCode() for more info.

        Sent in response to SOCBankTrade and SOCAcceptOffer. For a more specific reason, see REASON_NOT_YOUR_TURN.

        getPlayerNumber() is -1 if rejecting a player's port/bank trade request, otherwise is the client's player number.

        Requires minimum version VERSION_FOR_REPLY_REASONS.

        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_OFFER, Constant Field Values

      • REASON_NOT_YOUR_TURN

        public static final int REASON_NOT_YOUR_TURN
        Server's reply reason code when the requesting client can't make this trade now because it isn't their turn.

        Sent in response to SOCBankTrade.

        getPlayerNumber() will be -1.

        Requires minimum version VERSION_FOR_REPLY_REASONS.

        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_TRADE, Constant Field Values

      • REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_OFFER

        public static final int REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_OFFER
        Server's reason code when the requesting client can't make this trade offer now.

        Sent in response to SOCMakeOffer, but not SOCBankTrade.

        Requires minimum version VERSION_FOR_REPLY_REASONS.

        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_TRADE, Constant Field Values

      • SOCRejectOffer

        public SOCRejectOffer(java.lang.String ga,
                      int pn)
        Create a typical RejectOffer message without a reason code.
        Parameters:
        ga - the name of the game
        pn - the player number rejecting all offers made to them. Sent from server, always ignored when sent from client.
        See Also:
        SOCRejectOffer(String, int, int)

      • SOCRejectOffer

        public SOCRejectOffer(java.lang.String gameName,
                      int pn,
                      int reasonCode)
        Create a SOCRejectOffer message which may have a reason code. Clients older than v2.4.50 will ignore that field.
        Parameters:
        gameName - the name of the game
        pn - the player number rejecting offer(s), or -1 with some reason codes. Sent from server, always ignored when sent from client. Will be the client's own player number, unless otherwise noted in the reasonCode constant's javadoc
        reasonCode - Reason code constant, or 0 for none; see getReasonCode()
        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        SOCRejectOffer(String, int)

    • Method Detail

      • getGame

        public java.lang.String getGame()
        Description copied from interface: SOCMessageForGame
        Name of game this message is for, if any. Must not be null in a message sent to the server: If message is not about per-game structures or code, use SOCMessage.GAME_NONE.

        At the server, the message treater dispatches incoming SOCMessageForGames based on their getGame():

        • null: Message is ignored
        • SOCMessage.GAME_NONE: Message is handled by SOCServer itself or SOCServerMessageHandler
        • Any other game name: Looks for a game with that name, to dispatch to the GameHandler for that game's type. If no game with that name is found, the message is ignored.
        Specified by:
        getGame in interface SOCMessageForGame
        Returns:
        the name of the game

      • getPlayerNumber

        public int getPlayerNumber()
        The player number rejecting all offers made to them, when sent from server; can be -1 if getReasonCode() != 0, for example when rejecting client's bank trade request. When sent from client, server has always ignored this field; could be any value.
        Returns:
        the player number from server

      • getReasonCode

        public int getReasonCode()
        Optional reason code for why an offer was rejected by server or declined by a player: REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_TRADE, REASON_CANNOT_MAKE_OFFER, etc.

        The standard reason code values are > 0. Values < 0 can be used by third-party bots or forks.

        Ignored by clients older than v2.4.50 (VERSION_FOR_REPLY_REASONS).

        Returns:
        this message's Reason Code, or 0 if none
        Since:
        2.4.50

        Specified by:

        public static SOCRejectOffer parseDataStr(java.lang.String s)
        Parse the command String into a REJECTOFFER message.
        Parameters:
        s - the String to parse
        Returns:
        a REJECTOFFER message, or null if the data is garbled

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: SOCMessage
        Simple human-readable delimited representation, used for debug purposes: SOCPutPiece:game=test5|playerNumber=3|pieceType=0|coord=40a
        Could also be used by a SOCServer.recordGameEvent(String, SOCMessage) implementation.

        Within this representation, message parameters should be in same order used by SOCMessage.toCmd() and parseDataStr(..). Should be parseable by SOCMessage.parseMsgStr(String) which calls SOCMessage.stripAttribNames(String), which your class can override if needed.

        Specified by:
        toString in class SOCMessage
        Returns:
        a human readable form of the message
        See Also:
        SOCMessage.toCmd()
